DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Location And/Or Extension Inhibit Effective Interstitial Illumination Photodynamic Therapy Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether or not the location and extension of the tumor precludes an effective illumination of interstitial photodynamic therapy (I-PDT).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Location And/Or Extend Inhibit Effective Interstitial Illumination Photodynamic Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._To increase in length or duration._The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present._Existing in fact and ready for service._Photodynamic therapy used to treat deep-seated solid tumors.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredName: Location And/Or Extend Inhibition Effective Interstitial Illumination Photodynamic Therapy
Property.preferredDefinition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:To increase in length or duration.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:Existing in fact and ready for service.:Photodynamic therapy used to treat deep-seated solid tumors.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
To increase in length or duration.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.
Existing in fact and ready for service.
Photodynamic therapy that uses light-emitting fibers to treat deep-seated solid tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
